title: Stagnation in UP's economy
selftext:
UP's economy has been struggling for quite some time now, with growth slowing over the past 5 years ([https://www.hindustantimes.com/lucknow/gsdp-s-declining-growth-may-challenge-goal-of-making-uttar-pradesh-a-trillion-dollar-economy/story-30Fe6bfuFHecEnbNU8ts5K.html](https://www.hindustantimes.com/lucknow/gsdp-s-declining-growth-may-challenge-goal-of-making-uttar-pradesh-a-trillion-dollar-economy/story-30Fe6bfuFHecEnbNU8ts5K.html)). In current scenarios, even my comparatively tiny state (TS) will overtake them on 2025.

This year, its rank is estimated to slip from 3rd to 5th (KA and GJ overtake it). This is suggestive of a K shaped recovery, which would be disastrous for everyone (since your tax pays for this) ([https://www.nationalheraldindia.com/opinion/recovery-claimed-by-govt-based-on-second-quarter-gdp-estimates-is-dubious-and-fragile](https://www.nationalheraldindia.com/opinion/recovery-claimed-by-govt-based-on-second-quarter-gdp-estimates-is-dubious-and-fragile))

This is worrying because of its population and inequality. It's western districts are significantly richer than the poorer east, with Noida having a PCI over to 10x that of its poorest districts, and actually saw an increase over the past two years. To it's credit, it is investing in road infra, which, along with significant rail investment by the central government (such as the EDFC. ASEAN nations are also making use of the same formula for medium term growth ([https://thediplomat.com/2021/01/low-rates-are-pushing-us-capital-into-southeast-asia-what-happens-when-rates-go-up/](https://thediplomat.com/2021/01/low-rates-are-pushing-us-capital-into-southeast-asia-what-happens-when-rates-go-up/)).

[UP's GDP according to IBEF](https://preview.redd.it/p3acm1512vi61.png?width=375&format=png&auto=webp&s=8588d69914ab02d0e40133073cddb239a40aa850)

Sadly, commentary is usually politically tinted, such as [https://www.timesnownews.com/columns/article/yogis-economic-model-ensures-growth-with-more-jobs/701004](https://www.timesnownews.com/columns/article/yogis-economic-model-ensures-growth-with-more-jobs/701004). Investor opinion is pretty poor on account for infrastructure deficiencies and poor law and order ([https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/YEmTATLHyICNuNU0oVSuqL/Uttar-Pradesh-Indias-biggest-state-is-still-its-biggest-p.html](https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/YEmTATLHyICNuNU0oVSuqL/Uttar-Pradesh-Indias-biggest-state-is-still-its-biggest-p.html) [https://frontline.thehindu.com/cover-story/tall-claims/article32882389.ece](https://frontline.thehindu.com/cover-story/tall-claims/article32882389.ece)). This (obviously) translates to poor FDI ([https://dipp.gov.in/publications/fdi-statistics](https://dipp.gov.in/publications/fdi-statistics)).

&#x200B;

If anyone has some well written analysis or research papers which are 'neutral' let me know. I have looked into the aussie paper though.
